perturbation.original_text: Distributor will comply with all country, federal, state and local laws, ordinances, codes, regulations, rules, policies and procedures, Including, without limitation, all anti-corruption laws, Including, the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (Applicable Laws). Distributor can find more information about the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act at the following URL: http://www.usdoj.gov/criminal/fraud/docs/dojdocb.html, o r  b y contacting publicsectorcompllance@cisco.com.
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor will endeavor to comply with all country, federal, state and local laws, ordinances, codes, regulations, rules, policies and procedures, Including, without limitation, all anti-corruption laws, Including, the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (Applicable Laws). Distributor can find more information about the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act at the following URL: http://www.usdoj.gov/criminal/fraud/docs/dojdocb.html, o r  b y contacting publicsectorcompllance@cisco.com.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'will comply' with 'will endeavor to comply' introduces ambiguity, weakening the obligation to a 'best efforts' standard, which is open to interpretation and potentially allows for non-compliance with anti-corruption laws.

perturbation.original_text: Distributor remains responsible for undertaking appropriate and reasonable measures to ensure that its own relevant subcontractors, consultants, agents or representatives who interact with government​ affiliated organizations comply with applicable anti-corruption laws;
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor should consider taking steps to encourage its own relevant subcontractors, consultants, agents or representatives who interact with government​ affiliated organizations to be mindful of anti-corruption laws;
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires ‘appropriate and reasonable measures’ to ensure compliance from subcontractors; the modified version is vague. The word 'encourage' introduces ambiguity and provides very little assurance. Replacing 'comply' with 'be mindful of' further weakens the commitment.

perturbation.original_text: Distributor's key personnel who directly support Cisco's account have or will have completed training (provided by Distributor, Cisco Cisco's on-line anti-corruption training is available in numerous languages and is free of charge for up to five of Distributor's personnel at http://corpedia.com/clients/cisco/pre_reg.asp?lid-300446001., or another third party) on compliance with applicable anti-corruption laws within the past 12 months (from the date when this Agreement becomes effective);
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor's key personnel who directly support Cisco's account should have access to some information regarding compliance with applicable anti-corruption laws sometime within a reasonable timeframe.
perturbation.explanation: The original text has a clear requirement for training within 12 months; the modified text introduces multiple ambiguities. 'Should have access' is weaker than 'have completed training'. 'Some information' is vague regarding the amount or quality of training. 'Sometime within a reasonable timeframe' is also ambiguous regarding the timing of the training, contradicting the explicit 12-month requirement.
